title: Low priority que... for leaving a bot game
body:
I've had terrible internet troubles for the past couple of days, my ping spiking over 2000ms in some instances. You can imagine this is infuriating for not only me but other people in my games, so I stopped playing after I tried to play a ranked game and could not connect. Previous to this, I'd been placed in a 10 minute waiting time low priority queue, because of this lag.
I decided last night to play a cheeky Co-op vs AI match to see if my internet was any better, and guess what; 5 minutes in, 2000ms ping. I then tell the other people in the bot match (who seemed experienced enough) that i had to leave as i was unable to play. I woke up this morning to find that i'll have to sit 5 matches in a 20 minute low priority queue... over an HOUR AND A HALF of just waiting.

Is there anyway this can be removed, or do I have to sit for 20 minutes 5 times before my games?

replies.body: I felt your pain and i think they should reduce time depending on your ping ingame throughout your game and see when you left and what type of game e.g:co-op vs ai should be like probably the penalty is reduced about 50% and a few more depending on your ping.
